intro: Vallota grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered vallota, is a herbaceous perennial native to South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and a strong, aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Vallota grandiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
